/notes/bms.note1: This is the bms manager config file.
/notes/bms.note1a: The bms page of the ui display is outlined in /assets/bms/summay
/notes/bms.note1b: The /assets/bms table defines the racks or battery management uints, each has a template file with placements for selected key words
/notes/bms.note2: The /config/bms area is still under development
/notes/bms.note3: The /components/catl... tables define the incoming control words from the bms modbus interface
/notes/bms.note4: The /links/<bms> table  defines mapping of external interface components to internal control variables
/notes/bms.note5: There are some junk/test fields as well... they will removed soon

/faults/bms.note: Leave as is for now. This definition is needed for clear faults UI cmd to work

/alarms/bms.note: Leave as is for now. This definition is needed for clear alarms UI cmd to work

mbmu_warning_1.note: Mbmu Warning table with degrees reg 1 Appendix 1
mbmu_warning_1.note2: Writing a value to anything in /alarms/bms (in test_phil ) automatically produces an alarm or a warning

mbmu_warning_21.note: Mbmu Warning table without degrees reg 1 Appendix 2

enum.note: Bit 16 - Single Cell Voltage Overlimit Warning
Bit 17 - Single Cell Temperature Overlimit Warning

mbmu_warning_22.note: Mbmu Warning table without degrees reg 2 Appendix 2

TestVlink.note: This makes /site/ess_hs:test_vstat use the value from /components/test_vlink:test_status
